intro: Porroglossum marcojimeneziorum, commonly known as Marco Jiménez's porroglossum, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of many small florets. The plant typically features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, daisy-like flowers in shades of yellow or white. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
